result.execSummary:
The defendant Jay S Imme was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: JOC amended to allow Huber release for medical appointments

miscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

Not to consume alcoholic beverages or illegal drugs  
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional

Counseling/assessments deemed appropriate
Provide DNA sample
Sign releases to allow agent to have access to treatment providers records

timeConds.notes:
Huber release for medical appointments
Stay condition time if defendant is accepted into the Teen Challenge program.  Must stay in and coooperate with the program.  If defendant leaves the program he shall return to the Detention Center.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Amendment to days of credit & term of extended supervision

superMiscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.
Good faith effort to seek/maintain employment

Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia.  
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.  
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional.  
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription.
No contact directly or indirectly with Walgreen's in Sheboygan.
